homepage.description: High-level technology for students of Systems Engineering, Statistics, AI, and Cybersecurity.
homepage.labInfo: General information about the lab: location, main equipment, and research areas.

labs.estrategias: Digital Strategies Classroom for IT Training

descriptions.interactiva_description: This classroom promotes the application of new teaching and learning methodologies focused on students. It also offers a specialized space for group work and engineering project development.
descriptions.interactiva_location: Building C, second floor, room C1-204.
descriptions.interactiva_schedule1: Monday to Friday 7:00 am to 7:00 pm (continuous session)
descriptions.videojuegos_description: Provides students and professors with a specialized space to work on topics related to augmented reality and video game development. It features furniture that facilitates teamwork and allows for various spatial configurations. The lab includes Linux and Windows environments, specialized software, and supports the creation of customized virtual machines for greater flexibility in experimental setups. Additionally, it offers side spaces for thesis and research project development. Finally, it can be combined with the Computer Fundamentals Lab to increase capacity.
descriptions.videojuegos_location: Block H, third floor, room H-302.
descriptions.videojuegos_schedule1: Monday to Friday, 7:00 am to 7:00 pm
descriptions.fundamentos_description: Provides students and professors with a specialized space for collaborative work and the development of individual and group activities related to computer fundamentals. The furniture is designed to accommodate different work configurations and allows for activities with or without computers, supporting the conceptualization of problem-solving approaches and their implementation through computational tools. The lab features Linux and Windows environments through the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL), with design and development tools specific to the field, and supports the creation of customized virtual machines for greater flexibility in required setups. Additionally, it can be integrated with the Augmented Reality and Game Development Lab to offer a larger, more versatile workspace.
descriptions.fundamentos_location: Block H, third floor, room H-301.
descriptions.fundamentos_schedule1: Monday to Friday, 7:00 am to 7:00 pm
descriptions.estrategias_description: A space dedicated to teaching digital skills and competencies focused on the field of computer science. It provides tools and strategies for students to enhance their academic and professional performance in this area. The training is based on the use of state-of-the-art technology and digital resources.
descriptions.estrategias_location: Building D, third floor, room D-310
descriptions.estrategias_schedule1: Monday to Friday 7:00 am to 7:00 pm (continuous session)
descriptions.practicas_description: A laboratory used by students to work freely in different academic areas of Systems Engineering. It includes a laptop area where students can sit with their own devices and have wired or wireless access to the lab network.
descriptions.practicas_schedule1: Monday to Friday 7:00 am to 7:00 pm (continuous session)
descriptions.multimedia_description: Provides students and professors with a specialized space for work in mobile applications, human-computer interaction, and multimedia development. The lab runs on a Windows environment and supports the creation of customized virtual machines for greater flexibility in configurations. It is also equipped with a video projector and a 50-inch TV for device projection.
descriptions.multimedia_location: Block C, second floor, room C1-205B.
descriptions.multimedia_schedule1: Monday to Friday 7:00 am to 7:00 pm (continuous session)
descriptions.redes_description: Provides students and professors with a specialized space for network and cybersecurity practice using simulators and physical equipment. It includes both Linux and Windows environments with preinstalled virtual machines for flexible configurations. It is part of the Computational Infrastructure Laboratory along with the Computing Platforms Lab, which can be integrated for larger group work. It is also used for the local CISCO Academy courses at the Escuela Colombiana de Ingeniería Julio Garavito.
descriptions.redes_schedule1: Monday to Friday 7:00 am to 7:00 pm (continuous session)
descriptions.plataformas_description: Provides students and professors with a specialized space for work in the area of computational infrastructure, operating systems, and computing platforms. It offers dual boot Linux/Windows and allows the creation of customized virtual machines for flexible configurations. It is part of the Computational Infrastructure Laboratory along with the Computer Networks Laboratory, which can be integrated for large group work.
descriptions.plataformas_schedule1: Monday to Friday 7:00 am to 7:00 pm (continuous session)
descriptions.software_description: Provides students and professors with a specialsized space for work in the area of application and database development and adaptation. It offers both Linux and Windows environments and allows the creation of customized virtual machines, providing greater flexibility for required setups.
descriptions.software_schedule1: Monday to Friday 7:00 am to 7:00 pm (continuous session)
descriptions.C1-205A_description: Provides students and professors with a specialized space for work in the area of application and database development and adaptation. It offers both Linux and Windows environments and allows the creation of customized virtual machines, providing greater flexibility for required setups.
descriptions.C1-205A_location: Block C, second floor, room C1-205A
descriptions.C1-205A_schedule1: Monday to Friday 7:00 am to 7:00 pm (continuous session)
